page.title: 15Arrunden, near Holmfirth
page.content: The lane leading to Arrunden is only half a mile long and is in very poor condition.There are three different farms but only one farmyard.The farms cover about 50-60 acres.The land is used for grazing,silage,{haymaking}and a small area for vegetables.The hay is made by first cutting long grass and then the grass is turned a number of times by a machine until it is dry.The grass is put into rows by the same machine.The machine uses a rail at the back to help funnel the grass into rows.After that the dry grass is baled and taken to a barn.{Silage}is cut and rowed but it is taken while it is green and then stored under sheets. There are eight families and four of them work on the land.
